update.description:
It depends on [this Gazebo pull request](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/838/colors-textures-and-world-files-for-the/diff).

* robocup_spl_ball: The ball used in the league.

* robocup09_spl_field: This model contains the carpet, lines, and 2009 goals (yellow and blue).

* robocup14_spl_field: Carpet and lines only.

* robocup14_spl_goal: Current goal.

The current RoboCup environment uses the same goal in both sides of the field. This is why I have extracted the goal from the 2014 field and created a separate model for the goal. The 2009 field uses different goals and different colors for each team.
update.title: Models for the RoboCup SPL environment

pull_request.title: Models for the RoboCup SPL environment

pullrequest.title: Models for the RoboCup SPL environment

pull_request.title: Models for the RoboCup SPL environment

pullrequest.title: Models for the RoboCup SPL environment

content.raw:
Updated merging most of the visuals within the same link. I also modified the names from CamelCase to snake_case. I kept the plane for the soccer fields because I believe it's probably better to avoid accidental movements of the field.

Give it a try if you have some time to make sure that looks OK. Thanks for the comments.
content.html:
Updated merging most of the visuals within the same link. I also modified the names from CamelCase to snake_case. I kept the plane for the soccer fields because I believe it's probably better to avoid accidental movements of the field.

Give it a try if you have some time to make sure that looks OK. Thanks for the comments.

pull_request.title: Models for the RoboCup SPL environment

pullrequest.title: Models for the RoboCup SPL environment

content.raw: I like your suggestion, smaller is better. I didn't have any reason to have multiple links. It's fixed in b8d43c2, except when an element has a collision and a visual.
content.html: I like your suggestion, smaller is better. I didn't have any reason to have multiple links. It's fixed in b8d43c2, except when an element has a collision and a visual.

It depends on [this Gazebo pull request](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/838/colors-textures-and-world-files-for-the/diff).

pull_request.title: Models for the RoboCup SPL environment

pullrequest.title: Models for the RoboCup SPL environment

content.raw: Since the fields contain a ground_plane as a collision element, they cannot be selected and moved by the gazebo gui tools (try `grep IsPlane gazebo/gui/ModelManipulator.cc` to see some of this code). This may be preferred actually, so that you don't accidentally move the field while moving other objects around. I often accidentally move the starting pen in drcsim and that's annoying.
content.html: Since the fields contain a ground_plane as a collision element, they cannot be selected and moved by the gazebo gui tools (try grep IsPlane gazebo/gui/ModelManipulator.cc to see some of this code). This may be preferred actually, so that you don't accidentally move the field while moving other objects around. I often accidentally move the starting pen in drcsim and that's annoying.

pull_request.title: Models for the RoboCup SPL environment

pullrequest.title: Models for the RoboCup SPL environment

content.raw:
~~~
diff -r 3582b02f52c9 robocup_spl_ball/model.sdf
--- a/robocup_spl_ball/model.sdf	Thu Nov 14 15:33:35 2013 -0800
+++ b/robocup_spl_ball/model.sdf	Thu Nov 21 11:11:38 2013 -0800
@@ -5,6 +5,15 @@
     <link name="ball">
       <inertial>
         <mass>0.0056</mass>
+        <!-- inertia based on solid sphere 2/5 mr^2 -->
+        <inertia>
+          <ixx>2.37e-6</ixx>
+          <iyy>2.37e-6</iyy>
+          <izz>2.37e-6</izz>
+          <ixy>0</ixy>
+          <ixz>0</ixz>
+          <iyz>0</iyz>
+        </inertia>
       </inertial>
       <collision name="collision">
         <geometry>
~~~
content.html:
diff -r 3582b02f52c9 robocup_spl_ball/model.sdf
--- a/robocup_spl_ball/model.sdf    Thu Nov 14 15:33:35 2013 -0800
+++ b/robocup_spl_ball/model.sdf    Thu Nov 21 11:11:38 2013 -0800
@@ -5,6 +5,15 @@
     <link name="ball">
       <inertial>
         <mass>0.0056</mass>
+        <!-- inertia based on solid sphere 2/5 mr^2 -->
+        <inertia>
+          <ixx>2.37e-6</ixx>
+          <iyy>2.37e-6</iyy>
+          <izz>2.37e-6</izz>
+          <ixy>0</ixy>
+          <ixz>0</ixz>
+          <iyz>0</iyz>
+        </inertia>
       </inertial>
       <collision name="collision">
         <geometry>

pull_request.title: Models for the RoboCup SPL environment

pullrequest.title: Models for the RoboCup SPL environment

content.raw:
Rather than have separate links for each visual, why don't you put all the visuals under a single link? It may be more efficient.

EDIT: maybe it doesn't matter, but anything we put in the gazebo repository will be copied by other people, so I like to advocate efficient practices. This isn't urgent if it's too much work.
content.html:
Rather than have separate links for each visual, why don't you put all the visuals under a single link? It may be more efficient.

EDIT: maybe it doesn't matter, but anything we put in the gazebo repository will be copied by other people, so I like to advocate efficient practices. This isn't urgent if it's too much work.

content.raw: We need to add inertia values; the defaults are way too big.
content.html: We need to add inertia values; the defaults are way too big.
